FuncDef: The display port-tx-enabling-delay interface command displays information about the delay for an interface to send signals.
Examples: GigabitEthernet 1/0/0 set port-tx-enabling delay time is: 100 ms
GigabitEthernet 1/0/0 remanent time of enabling port-tx is: 20 ms
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a delay is configured for an interface to send signals using the port-tx-enabling-delay interface command, you can run the display port-tx-enabling-delay interface command to check the configured delay and the remaining time for the interface to send signals.
